definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: This paper analyzes and summarizes the quality common faults in sinking well construction.
sentences.chinese: 本文就沉井施工中的质量通病进行了分析和总结。

sentences.english: The common failing of human nature I can not escape, or even more.
sentences.chinese: 人性的通病我无法免俗，甚至还有更多的问题。

sentences.english: The common fault of "Mass Media Age" is lengthiness and roughness.
sentences.chinese: “大媒体时代”的标题通病是长和粗。

sentences.english: The separation on the top of secondary liner is one of the common failures of tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 二次衬砌顶部脱空已成为比较严重的隧道质量通病。

sentences.english: Common fault in open caisson engineering quality has been analyzed and sum up in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文就沉井施工中的质量通病进行分析和总结。

sentences.english: Maneuverability is home to many enterprise's common failing.
sentences.chinese: 可操作性差是国内许多企业的通病。

sentences.english: Curiosity you know is the curse of our sex, and that 's the fact.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，好奇是我们女人家的通病，这是真的。

sentences.english: The deformation and destroying of high embankment is the common problem of high way.
sentences.chinese: 高填路堤的变形破坏是公路工程质量通病之一。

sentences.english: Bad pronunciation is a common fault among students in this class.
sentences.chinese: 发音不好是这班同学的通病。

sentences.english: Being too large and all-encompassing is a common defect among state-owned enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 过分追求大而全，是国企的一大通病。

sentences.english: It seems the problem with attractive men is that they lack personality.
sentences.chinese: 帅男似乎都存在一个通病，即他们缺少个性。

sentences.english: The leakage of stretching-and-shrinking space is a frequent phenomenon in the hydraulic concrete buildings.
sentences.chinese: 伸缩沉降缝漏水是水工建筑物中一种常见的质量通病。

sentences.english: Impatience is a disease in our society.
sentences.chinese: 没有耐心是我们社会的通病。

sentences.english: The problem with most compa-nies is complacency.
sentences.chinese: 自鸣得意是大多数公司的通病。

sentences.english: Their reason is this - if the household has money, then get someone else to do it.
sentences.chinese: 不愿做家务，这是上海年轻女人的通病。

sentences.english: In a sexist male society, that's a common illness.
sentences.chinese: 大凡男权社会的男人，都有这种通病。

definition: to trace something to its source (idiom)
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
hard lump in the abdomen (in Chinese medicine)/crux of an issue/main point in an argument/sticking point/deadlock in negotiations
mistaken ideas/misconceptions/the error of one's ways
